question: Question about my alcohol intake?
question_content:
Okay so I was just wondering about units in alcohol, i know im only supposed to be having 2-3 units a day, But i dont know how much of something makes up a unit.
-I'll normally have a little sherry/brandy/bourbon before college (always have since i was a lil kid and always will, its warms you on a winters morning, me and all my family do this throughout winter) id say about 50cl.
-When I get home i'll have about 1 and a half bottles of red wine(about 13-14% proof) but if my mum drinks it with me we'll easily have at least 2 bottles each#this is every night.
-Twice a week my gran will come round and bring a litre bottle of (smirnoff red)vodka and well share that between us both so id say about a litre/just over of vodka a week as well.

This is every week, and I don't know how to work the units out,
I'm 18 female british if that makes a difference,
Apart from the drinking my lifestyle really isnt too bad, on occasion(ok every day) ill smoke about £20 (2/8 Oz) worth of pot, but thats not much compared to some people i know.
-
Could someone please tell me what my units are?

answers.answer_content:
Jeez... you are WAY over 2-3 units a day.

50ml bourbon or brandy = 2 units. I really hope you don't drink 50cl every morning.

500ml of vodka = 20 units... twice = 40 units.

Bottle of wine = 8 units... one and a half = 12 and two = 16

So you are drinking 14-20 units every day and then adding another 40 over the week. That's liver-damage quantities. Or on the road to being an alcoholic. I really hope you don't drive because you must often be over the legal limiit.
so you like to catch a good buzz, ain't nothing wrong with that.
You are a waste to society
I'm not sure but that is a lot of liquor.
